conclusion: To determine the temperature at state D, analyze the cyclic process using the ideal gas law.
The ABCDA cycle is composed of four processes: AB (isochoric), BC (isobaric), CD (isochoric), DA (isobaric).
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT.
Temperature at state A is T_0, so P1 V1 = n R T_0 and T_A = T_0.
For state B, since AB is isochoric, T_B = P2 V1 / (n R) and T_B > T_A.
For state C, since BC is isobaric, T_C = P2 V2 / (n R) and T_C > T_B.
For state D, since CD is isochoric, T_D = P1 V2 / (n R) and T_D < T_C.
Given the cyclic nature, T_D = T_A = T_0.
